Description: Bronze axe-head: with two lugs. The two binding-holes are properly positioned. The blade is lightly corroded, the line of the original haft being preserved on one face. The cutting edge is severely indented through use.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. A. W. Budge in 'Archaeologica: or Miscellaneous Tracts relating to Antiquity' 53 (London, 1892), 91.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (41)
Condition: incomplete - haft missing, cutting edge indented
